questions.question: Sheet metal is simply ______ formed into thin and flat pieces:

explanations.a: Sheet metal is not made from nonmetals.
explanations.b: Noble gases cannot be formed into sheets.
explanations.c: Halogens do not form sheet metal.
explanations.d: Sheet metal is thin, flat metal material.

questions.question: There are many different metals that can be made into sheet metal, such as ______, brass, copper, steel, tin, nickel and titanium:

explanations.a: Uranium is not commonly used for sheet metal.
explanations.b: Silver is rarely used due to cost.
explanations.c: Aluminium is widely used in sheet metal industries.
explanations.d: Gold is not commonly used due to high cost.

questions.question: The maximum thickness of sheet above which it is called plate:

explanations.a: 4 mm still falls under sheet metal.
explanations.b: 5 mm is generally the upper limit for sheets.
explanations.c: Thickness above 5 mm is considered plate.

questions.question: In which of the bending operation tip of punch does not touch the bottom of lower die:

explanations.a: In V-bending, punch may bottom out.
explanations.b: In air bending, punch does not touch the die bottom.
Springback is generally undesirable in forming.
explanations.c: Its effect is well understood and usually undesired.

questions.question: In roll-bending process ___________ of rod occurs:

explanations.a: Rolling alone does not define the process.
explanations.c: Roll-bending involves both rolling and bending actions.
explanations.d: Stretching is not the main mechanism.

questions.question: Which types of rod could be put into roll-bending process?

explanations.c: I-shaped rods can also be bent.
explanations.d: Roll bending can handle rods of various shapes.

questions.question: Identify the type of rotation of rollers A, B and C respectively:

explanations.a: All rollers rotating same direction is incorrect.
explanations.b: Middle roller rotates opposite for bending.
explanations.c: Roller directions do not match standard setup.
explanations.d: Standard roll bending uses opposite rotation for feed rollers.

questions.question: The strain developed in the rod is due to:

explanations.a: Single roller does not cause total strain.
explanations.b: Central roller alone is not responsible.
explanations.d: Combined action of all rollers develops strain.

questions.question: Feed rollers in the process are used for:

answers.a: Feeding and reducing the thickness of rod
answers.b: Feeding the rod and bending the rod

explanations.a: Thickness reduction is not the objective.
explanations.b: Feed rollers both feed and assist bending.
explanations.c: They do more than just feeding.
explanations.d: Bending alone is not their only role.
